intro: Stigmaphyllon microphyllum, commonly known as the small-leaved stigmaphyllon, is a member of the Malvaceae family, native to South America. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its small, ovate leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in dry, open habitats. Its fruits are capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
